alert.note: Alert for Sussex (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 02 at 6:44PM EDT until June 02 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Sussex County in southern Delaware... * Until 730 PM EDT. * At 644 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bridgeville to near Delmar, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Seaford, Millsboro, Laurel, Lewes, Milton, Selbyville, Bridgeville, Delmar, Dagsboro, Millville, Henlopen Acres, Gumboro, Cape Henlopen State Park, Sycamore, Long Neck, Ocean View, Blades, Frankford and South Bethany. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
